title: Caf� Jardim
content: Is the word Jardim a custom work? Sorry for the small sample. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25379.gif)
author: fermello78

comments.content: I don't know what it is, but I don't think it's Mekanik. They spelled Espresso with an x, so it makes me think it's a free font. ;-)
We say "expresso" here in Brazil... that's a brazilian coffee
You don't think it could be Mekanik that has been 'squooshed' a bit, as we say?

I give up hard, but maybe all this proves is that Mekanik is similar. Anyway, I did minor tweaking and got this. result:   
 ![JARDIM Simulation with Mekanik](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25382.gif)

_We say "expresso" here in Brazil... that's a brazilian coffee._   
   
Heh--sorry. I didn't realize it was from Brazil. That's the way people often misspell Espresso in English.   
   
Mike, you make a good case, and it's very close, but I still don't think that's it. When you squooshed Mekanik, it also made the horizontals proportionally too thin.
Apparently Caf� Jardim was founded in 1890, so I'd say it is a custom thing.
Well, maybe the logo has been redesigned through the years, but IIRC this is pretty old.
If you want something similar, you could try House Gothic (no rounded M though).
